remarks.format:
## Remarks This class represents a collection of pairs, where each pair consists of a string serving as a collection key and a string value. Because the first element is a key, it must be unique across the collection.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the KeyValueConfigurationCollection type.
[!CODE [System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the Add method to add a new <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement> object to the collection.

Gets the keys to all items contained in the <see cref="T:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection"> collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the Clear method is called, it removes all <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement> objects from the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement CreateNewElement() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, the CreateNewElement method creates a new <see cref="T:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"> object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Override the CreateNewElement method to create custom <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement> objects. When a collection is loaded from the configuration file, the CreateNewElement method is called to create individual elements. The CreateNewElement method must be overridden in classes that derive from the <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance object GetElementKey(class System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement element) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"> to which the key should be returned.
Docs.summary: Gets the element key for a specified configuration element when overridden in a derived class.
Docs.returns: An object that acts as the key for the specified <see cref="T:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement">.

Docs.param: The key of the <see cref="T:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"> contained in the collection.
Docs.summary: Gets the <see cref="T:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"> object based on the supplied parameter.
Docs.value: A configuration element, or `null` if the key does not exist in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the Item property to get a <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement> object in the collection based on the parameter.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of configuration properties.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Remove(string key) cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes a <see cref="T:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"> object from the collection.

Gets a value indicating whether an attempt to add a duplicate <see cref="T:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"> object to the <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection> collection will cause an exception to be thrown.
Docs.value: `true` if an attempt to add a duplicate <see cref="T:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationElement"> to the <xref:System.Configuration.KeyValueConfigurationCollection> will cause an exception to be thrown; otherwise, `false`.
